title: co.combinatorics - Is there a characterization for the finite sequences of natural numbers which are the shifts of a permutation?
body: Given a natural number $k<n$ and a permutation $\sigma\in S_n$ , I will call $k$ a shift of $\sigma$ if there is some $m$ with $\sigma(m)-m\equiv k \mod n$ . If one is given a sequence $s=(x_1,...,x_n)$ of $n$ natural numbers between $0$ and $n-1$ , is there some known way to determine whether $s$ represents the shifts of some permutatuon in $S_n$ ? If not, I am also interested in relevant heuristics.
